did.abstract: Account book of St. Paul's Free Church for the period 1834 to 1840, including treasurer's accounts of income and expenditures; accounts of the minister, vestry, and sexton; and lists of special donations.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: St. Paul's Free Church was an Episcopal congregation formed by former members of St. Ann's, Brooklyn's earliest Episcopal church. St. Paul's purchased a building on Pearl Street (later Concord Street), but suspended services in 1840. It reopened later as Calvary Church, but had ceased to exist by 1862.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of St. Paul's Free Church for the period 1834 to 1840, including treasurer's accounts of income and expenditures; accounts of the minister, vestry, and sexton; and lists of special donations.
